meanings.definition: (verb) To tuck or gather a garment into the waistband of pants or a skirt.
meanings.sent1: She bloused her shirt neatly into her pants before the job interview.
meanings.sent2: The soldier bloused his boots to keep them secure during the march.
meanings.sent3: The chef bloused the apron into his pants, ready to cook up a storm.
meanings.sent4: The dancer bloused her costume, transforming into a graceful swan on stage.
meanings.sent5: He bloused the fabric with precision, creating a tailored look for the fashion show.

meanings.definition: (adjective) Wearing a loose-fitting, gathered garment that is tucked into the waistband.
meanings.sent1: She felt comfortable in her bloused top as she strolled through the park.
meanings.sent2: The bloused dress flowed elegantly as she twirled on the dance floor.
meanings.sent3: The bloused blouse added a touch of chic to her casual outfit.
meanings.sent4: The bloused sweater draped beautifully over her shoulders, keeping her warm.
meanings.sent5: He admired her bloused look, appreciating the effortless style she carried.
